definition: to draw out/to pull out from in between/to remove part of the whole/(of certain plants) to sprout or bud/to whip or thrash
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: The pump was stuttering out water.
sentences.chinese: 抽水機突突地冒出了水。

sentences.english: He hopelessly approached the corner of the cottage and surprisingly found a water pump.
sentences.chinese: 他幾近絕望地走到屋角，卻意外地發現了一座抽水機。

sentences.english: The pump is actuated by a belt driven by an electric motor.
sentences.chinese: 這臺抽水機由電動機皮帶驅動。

sentences.english: Pumped hydro is the first idea.
sentences.chinese: 抽水機抽氫是首選想法。

sentences.english: In a word, I was so surprised, that I fell down in a Swoon.
sentences.chinese: 一句話，我嚇得暈倒在抽水機旁。

sentences.english: So they are using their treadle pumps again.
sentences.chinese: 所以他們重新使用踏板抽水機。

sentences.english: We use pumps to feed fresh water into the boiler.
sentences.chinese: 我們用抽水機給鍋爐加水。

sentences.english: They also carried two pumps to remove salt from ocean water.
sentences.chinese: 他們還帶了兩個抽水機，用來除去海水中的鹽。

sentences.english: How do you pump out bilge water in the engine room?
sentences.chinese: 您怎樣將機倉的污抽水機出弦外？

sentences.english: Our water comes from the pump of a private well.
sentences.chinese: 我們的水，是用抽水機從私人井裏抽出。

sentences.english: At the farm there was an old-fashioned pump for drawing water from a well.
sentences.chinese: 那個農場有一臺老式的用來從井裏抽水的抽水機。

sentences.english: At the farm there was an oldfashioned pump for drawing water from a well.
sentences.chinese: 那個農場有一臺老式的抽水機，用來從井裏抽水。
